history.content: Are you sure you would even be allowed to an extra semester? If you're L&S CS, there's a unit ceiling:  https://ls.berkeley.edu/advising/planning/enrolling/unit-ceiling

children.subject: Yep I've checked and this wouldn't be an issue.
Are you sure you would even be allowed to an extra semester? If you're L&S CS, there's a unit ceiling:  https://ls.berkeley.edu/advising/planning/enrolling/unit-ceiling

history.content:
Your degree would list whatever semester you complete your last courses and change your graduation term to. This can be May, August, or December. 

I would think a little about recruitment and graduate school admissions cycles. Will it be harder to get a January start date?


Student's point is correct, are you eligible for an additional semester?

children.subject: Thank you for the input and the advice!

I'm a student who is staying an extra semester and honestly, it has been really good for me. I studied abroad, but due to different school terms with the country I studied in, I was unable to get an internship for one of the summers, so staying another semester enabled me to get an extra internship under my belt. 

I can't speak for grad school stuff, but whenever I have told companies that my reason for the fall graduation date is studying abroad, they've been impressed/surprised/never reacted negatively. 

The main issues I had with staying an extra semester are paying more tuition, and trying to find fall-only housing. I got a part-time job to deal with the former; still kinda stressing about the latter. So keep these issues in mind if you haven't considered them.

history.content:
Hello,

I'm thinking about staying an extra semester (pushing my target graduation date from SP20 --> F20) and had a few questions regarding this decision.  I'm considering doing this mainly for learning purposes, but I don't plan on pursuing an extra major, and hope to be able to study abroad.  A concern my parents have is would staying an extra semester reflect negatively on job / graduate school applications in any way?  Would my official attained degree date be F20 or would it say SP21 if I just take one extra semester?  

Would welcome any other general advice about this as well!  Thank you!
history.subject: Advice on staying an extra semester
